DOMESTIC_ANIMALS.explanationText: This is a Cow, it gives us milk.
This is a Goat, kept for milk and meat.
This is a Sheep, gives us wool.
This is a Dog, loyal domestic animal.
This is a Cat, a pet animal.
This is a Horse, used for riding.
This is a Donkey, used for carrying loads.
This is a Camel, also domesticated in deserts.
This is a Pig, raised for meat.
This is a Hen, gives us eggs.
This is a Duck, a water bird kept at home.
This is a Turkey, also domesticated bird.
This is a Goose, raised for eggs and meat.
This is a Pigeon, kept as pet bird.
This is a Rabbit, kept as pet.
This is a Parrot, a pet bird known for talking.
This is a Mule, a cross of donkey and horse.
This is a Buffalo, gives us milk.
This is an Ox, used for ploughing fields.
This is a Yak, domesticated in mountains.

FLOWERS.explanationText: This is a Rose, known as the king of flowers.
This is a Sunflower, it always turns towards the sun.
This is a Lotus, the national flower of India.
This is a Marigold, widely used in festivals.
This is Jasmine, famous for its fragrance.
This is a Tulip, popular in the Netherlands.
This is a Hibiscus, often used in worship of Goddess Kali.
This is a Daisy, symbol of purity.
This is a Lily, a symbol of beauty and purity.
This is an Orchid, a rare and exotic flower.
This is Lavender, known for its soothing fragrance.
This is Chrysanthemum, widely used in decoration.
This is a Daffodil, a spring flower.
This is a Poppy, bright red in color.
This is a Carnation, symbol of love and admiration.
This is a Peony, known for its large blooms.
This is a Magnolia, famous for its fragrance.
This is a Bluebell, a bell-shaped flower.
This is Gladiolus, a tall flower with colorful petals.
This is a Petunia, common in gardens.
This is a Zinnia, bright and colorful.

REPTILES.explanationText: This is a Crocodile, found in rivers and lakes.
This is an Alligator, similar to crocodile but with broad snout.
This is a Lizard, common reptile found in houses.
This is a Snake, a legless reptile.
This is a Turtle, lives in water and on land.
This is a Tortoise, lives mostly on land.
This is a Chameleon, changes its skin color.
This is an Iguana, found in tropical regions.
This is a King Cobra, the longest venomous snake.
This is a Python, a non-venomous constrictor snake.
This is an Anaconda, one of the heaviest snakes.

WILD_ANIMALS.explanationText: This is a Lion, the king of the jungle.
This is a Tiger, known for its stripes.
This is an Elephant, the largest land animal.
This is a Bear, found in forests.
This is a Leopard, known for its spotted skin.
This is a Zebra, with black and white stripes.
This is a Giraffe, the tallest animal.
This is a Rhinoceros, with a horn on its nose.
This is a Hippopotamus, found in rivers.
This is a Wolf, ancestor of dogs.
This is a Fox, known for being clever.
This is a Cheetah, the fastest land animal.
This is a Kangaroo, native to Australia.
This is a Panda, found in China.
This is a Koala, found in eucalyptus forests of Australia.
This is a Crocodile, found in rivers and lakes.
This is an Alligator, similar to crocodiles but with a broader snout.
This is a Camel, known as the ship of the desert.
This is a Deer, with beautiful antlers.
This is a Monkey, known for climbing trees.
This is a Gorilla, the largest primate.
This is a Hyena, known for its laughing sound.
This is a Jackal, found in forests and villages.
This is a Bison, found in North America.
This is a Yak, found in the Himalayan region.
